sentences.sContent: I felt I'd made an incredible discovery.
sentences.sCn: 我感到自己有了一个惊人的发现。

sentences.sContent: ...But scientists released a report Monday documenting with hard evidence the discovery of lost lions...
...the company chose to shelf its new discovery to focus on its traditionalfilm business...
...the company chose to shelf its new discovery to focus on its traditional film business...
...the discovery marked a huge step toward determining the cause of a tragedy in which 152 passengers were killed...

synos.tran: 发现，发觉；被发现的事物

phrases.pCn: 伟大的发现；好棒的发现
愉景湾（位于香港大屿山东北部分）；发现湾（哥伦布第一脚踏上的土地）

trans.tranOther: a fact or thing that someone finds out about, when it was not known about before
